website_summaries.verdict: Mack's soft foam material and value offers an option ideal for individuals with smaller ear canals or those prone to discomfort from wearing earplugs.
pros: Comfortable fit for narrow ear canals
cons: Protects to 29 decibels — lower than comparable foam earplugs

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure if these are too long for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if these are too long for my ears or what, I'm having a hard time wearing them securely while blocking out sound - tho I did take a tip from another reviewer and opened my jaw while inserting the ear plugs and that does seem to help. I'm providing a side by side photo of these slim fit next to standard CVS green ear plugs for comparison. Other reviewer photos helped me originally and I want to return the favor
customer_reviews.author: rbtzn

customer_reviews.title: Best for sensitive ears
customer_reviews.text: I use these to sleep. They don't have the highest sound rating, but they're perfectly fine to block out traffic and other noise from the street or people talking quietly in my apartment. I've been sleeping with earplugs for over a decade and my inside of my ears can get quite painful with other types of earplugs. I've been using the Slim Fit ones for over a year now and I never have any ear pain; periodically I'll use a different earplug, because I still have some left from before I switched, and I always have ear pain after one or two nights. I'm a relatively small (5'1") woman and I suppose my ear canals are correspondingly smaller.
customer_reviews.author: BC2

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I used to use those cylindrical earplugs (terrible!), then discovered Macks. Macks have been my favorites for years, but I just noticed this "slim fit" version. I took a chance on them, and they are my new hands down favorite. I hadn't even noticed that the regular Macks were too wide for me (since they were so much better than the others I'd tried), but these are a big improvement for me. If your ears are ever even a little bit sore after using earplugs, do yourself a favor and try these.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered the regular Mack foam earplugs for years and decided to try these Slim Fit to see if they were more comfortable. There were numerous problems with them. They were no more comfortable...perhaps less comfortable, my ears itched and felt irritated either from the latex or the purple dye and they were not at all noise blocking. Terrible product! Returned them and I am going back to the regular ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kakesalina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable ear plugs that work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are smaller than the “Sleep Pretty” by Hearos (which are also supposed to be for smaller ear canals). The NRR is 29 compared to NRR 32 so they aren’t quite as effective. Definitely more comfortable though so not waking up in the middle of the night with aching ears is a huge bonus. Only one more month until I move away from my noisy neighbors but if I find myself needing ear plugs again the in the future, I’ll definitely consider purchasing these again.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Changed mold and material from those pictured
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product before and was very satisfied. They were slim enough that they didn’t hurt my ears when I wore them every day to sleep. The most recent box I bought had a slightly different product in them. They are wider and a lighter color purple. They are also not as soft and easy to mold. It seems like the manufacturer used a slightly different material and a different mold. I’ll give this company one more shot. Maybe I got one bad batch. I spend a lot of time wearing these earplugs and I hope the product is more consistent in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: contact dermatitis?
customer_reviews.text: Whatever it is, I'm not happy. I have a rash in my ear canal from sleeping with these things in place. Have to book an appointment with an ENT. Won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowcatcherTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Can't Get a Good Seal
customer_reviews.text: I really have a hard time getting these to form a proper seal. Because they are slim, I was hoping for a better fit. And they do seem to fit well. However, a good fit is pointless if there is not a good seal. For now, it's back to the. They don't fit to perfection, either. However, the 3M neons block more noise than the Mack's Slim Fits do. At least for me. Everyone's ears are different so the Mack's may be worth trying if you've tried other plugs that are too large.
customer_reviews.author: S. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the best ear plugs we have ever purchased. (the temporary/single use type). They are easy to use, comfortable and do what ear plugs are meant to do, keep the noise out!! I did see some reviews that gave me pause before buying these, reviews that stated these could be uncomfortable, even painful. I can see how this might be an issue for some as these are easily compressed into a very small shape so they can be inserted in the ear canal. The first time I used them I did just that, inserting them too deeply and finding them to be uncomfortable. Easily corrected though, just reinserted them but not as deeply. Outstanding product/worth every penny.....
customer_reviews.author: quickfarmlane

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT FIT MY EARS!
customer_reviews.text: Just awful. This ear plug squishes to 1/4 of its size and does not fit my particular ear. at all. After reading the instructions carefully, I tried 3 of them, all with the same results. They didn’t fit snugly. They didn’t block any sound. After removing, they looked like squished up purple monster 💩. Back to my silicone waterproof earplugs that are easier to insert and actually work. Save your money. Avoid these.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog Lady

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small. I’m a light sleeper and all I want is comfortable earplugs that block out the sound of my air conditioner. I’ve used many brands, most recently Hearos Extreme (blue ones in photo) which are too long and hurt to sleep with. I guess that makes me Goldilocks. I am really getting tired of the hit and miss nature of purchasing things from Amazon, sight unseen. I’m sure these are fine for some, just not me. Basically I wasted another $12 buying without trying. No idea if they’re returnable
customer_reviews.author: detour

customer_reviews.title: finally i found the perfect ear plug for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: finally i found the perfect ear plug for sleeping, my snoring wife, noisy hotels all are no match. the soft foam plugs fit well and are easy to wear. it took trying many different brands to finally find the correct ones. i have by the side of my bed and never leave home without them.
customer_reviews.author: Astrobratt

customer_reviews.title: defective batch- quality control!
customer_reviews.text: These are defective. Something is wrong with this batch. They have worked for me before, but they are not squishable and do not stay rolled long enough without expanding to get in your ear, and block out no sound. I have lost a lot of sleep after getting this new order of them. The seller should replace them with good ones.
customer_reviews.author: Oystercatcher

customer_reviews.title: Can't get them in
customer_reviews.text: Maybe they are too soft. Maybe it's me, but I just spent almost 30 min trying to get them in. I follow the directions but they seem to bend over instead of going in. Yes I roll the end, I reach over the top of my head with the opposite hand and pull up on my ear. I hold it in there for a while to no avail. Too frustrating. Last try I just threw them across the room. I've used other ones before but I ordered the slim fit since I have narrow canals. Seems like a slightly more rigid material in the core would easily solve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: TimothyNC

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: My husband snores, so I was looking into an ear plug that would be comfortable, but also effective in giving me a good night's rest. My ear canal is small, so most normal sized ear plugs would cause soreness or discomfort after prolonged or repeated use. These are small, so they are more comfortable, and also get the job done! They don't block out 100% of noise (but then again, I haven't encountered an ear plug that does), but it is enough for me to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ong

customer_reviews.title: It helped drown out yapping dog
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help me not hear my across the street neighbor's loud yappy dog at 5:30am. I heard the yapping this morning, but put in one ear plug and was able to go back to sleep. Putting just one in did the trick. I didnt want to put 2 in for fear of not hearing my alarm clock. I have small ear canals and I was able to get the plugs to fit pretty well with minimum effort. These plugs work better than the window acoustic foam I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: MizzTea

customer_reviews.title: Discomfort in ear due to materials used.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to go with these and I was really the satisfied with the comfort. I was used to the other name brand ear plugs that are here on Amazon. I found these at a discounted price so I decided to give it a try. Compared to the other brand these had a shiny coating that was uncomfortable for me while sleeping. There were times when I try to remove them and it's stuck to my ear canal which is a very sensitive part. They did fit well since I do you have small ears, but the discomfort is not worth it. I'll be returning these I'm going back to my original brand.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Song

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to sleep in, I'm a stomach sleeper & they don't hurt my ears at all. I use them daily. These are very small, just put them in so they barely stick out of your ear, so you can still grasp them with your nails to take them out. They are for small ear canals. I will be getting more, I got 50 pairs. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because of high recommendation from Wirecutter. Unfortunately they're not for me. They don't fit.my ear. They block minimal noise and are uncomfortable. The search for the perfect earplug continues...
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: I Didn't Even Notice My Husband Had Slept in Bed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd type I've tried and these actually work well! My hubby snores terribly, so much so that some nights he gets kicked to the couch. The other night he said he hoped he hadn't bothered me when he slept in bed last night... I was confused... I hadn't been woken by his snoring - this is how effective the earplugs are - like sleeping in a nice quite room alone while in reality sleeping next to a husband whose snores sound similar to that of a car! Thanks Mack for suppressing the sounds of that Mac truck sleeping beside me in the form of a husband!!
customer_reviews.author: Out In the Woods

customer_reviews.title: Small!
customer_reviews.text: I was willing to give up some noise level protection for a more comfortable fit. I'm a small woman and even the pink ones were too big. I was getting a headache at night from using them all night long. Not so with these. They fit well and are much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: They're comfortable at least...
customer_reviews.text: I have small ear canals and just about every earplug I've tried is painful to wear. These had received fairly good reviews for both comfort and noise cancellation, so I decided to try. Yes, they are very comfortable. They squish and fit well. Unfortunately, there was zero noise cancellation. I could clearly hear my husband snoring, my cat purring, and my white noise machine. I'll try the next size up and see if those work any better.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie B.

customer_reviews.title: Not THAT small!
customer_reviews.text: On the advice of two audiologists that I have smaller-than-average ear canals, and tired of achy outer ears, I tried these. Absolutely TOO small -- fell out, every time I turned over. So I can't say they weren't comfortable, but they did not keep any noise out, or not enough to matter. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Small-business owner

customer_reviews.title: The snoring continues loud and proud ☹️
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in an attempt to block out my husbands snoring. As soon as they arrived I went up to the second level of our house and put a pair in, expecting total silence. To my dismay, there was zero reduction in sound. I could hear everything happening on our lower level as though I was listening with naked ears. Suffice to say, these would definitely not block out a snoring husband in a much closer proximity 😑. Back to my search for blissful silence 😩
customer_reviews.author: Janet P

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Effective
customer_reviews.text: We have a puppy who sleeps in her crate in our room (loudly). I was using airplane ear plugs and they would not fit fully into my ear, so I continued to wake up every time she did. These are much easier to shape and fit tightly. I have noticed that after 2-3 uses, it becomes more difficult to get a proper fit and I will hear through the plugs. For the most part, they are effective until the morning and confortable!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Klein

customer_reviews.title: Did not block out even the sound of my dog breathing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to help block out the noise at night. They did not even come close to blocking out even the most subtle sounds such as my dog sleeping sounds. I am perplexed that others have had such success
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Tugman

customer_reviews.title: They’re great
customer_reviews.text: My ear canals are small but not very very small, I’m a grown man. Regular earplugs get uncomfortable for me after 30 minutes and painful after 90 minutes. These do not ever get uncomfortable or painful and they work just as well as any earplug. I recommend this if you have small canals like me. I’ve used them shooting and riding a motorcycle and they work fine for both activities.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have tiny earholes. Other sizes have made my ears sore. They are the most comfortable and cancel out all outside noise. However, why does a brand new container always smell like low tide and dead fish when opened?
customer_reviews.author: Christina Casais

customer_reviews.title: Good for Small Ears!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Not as good as I would like for noise canceling but add some white noise in the background and these are exactly what I need! I have really loud upstairs neighbors and I work Overnights so these are perfect when I need to sleep the next morning. I have very tiny ears and have struggled a long time to find good earplugs I tried the Mack’s pink collection but they were still too big! These don’t hurt my ears!!! I will buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: makayla

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a different brand which were much larger than these and which didn't always compress down to the size they should have. After throwing a lot of those away, I decided to try a different brand. I chose these and they work so much better for me. I have a very noisy upstairs neighbor and if I don't wear earplugs overnight, she wakes me up in the morning. This brand blocks out the noise much better than the other brand. I will stick with these.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: If regular size ear plugs hurt or pop out, give these a try!
customer_reviews.text: Guess I must have smaller than average ear canals for an adult, as these fit me perfectly, and don’t hurt or pop out, as the standard sizes do. They also fit my wife and son, so one box meets all of our ear pro needs. I like to pack these for trips to Disney, so we don’t blow out our ears standing next to speakers during parades, shows, or fireworks.
customer_reviews.author: Gradient Echo

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the 1 star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a full grown man. These fit nicely in my ears for sleep and don't create pressure like regular sized ones. They seal completely and are true to their noise blocking rating. My roommates refuse to close the windows next to an industrial AC unit and a freeway and when these are in I can't hear either. They are much more comfortable than any others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are great. As a smaller-framed female, I find that most disposable earplugs are very uncomfortable. I dislike purchasing "obviously for women" products, especially if they're pink. Those earplugs typically cost more, and I don't need any more pink in my life. These fit great, and are a higher quality than others I've tried. For complete noise-cancellation I will use my electronic noise cancelling ear protection, but for sleeping through my upstairs neighbor's stomping, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia White

customer_reviews.title: Best foam plug I've ever worn...
customer_reviews.text: I worked in industry for almost 30 years.. Worn all kinds of ear plugs.. These are the best ever... I have a small ear canal and other plugs were difficult to insert... then they would work out... and the noise was not stopped..... First thing I noticed, after inserting the plugs, was how quiet is was.. They inserted farther than other plugs had.. They sealed TIGHT in the ear canal and man was it quiet... These plugs are keepers... I will order them again...
customer_reviews.author: DAVEWASHINGTON

customer_reviews.title: Feel like Goldilocks and the three earplugs
customer_reviews.text: My husband first bought me the pink version and it was okay but I wasn’t completely in love with it. Then the tan one was sent to us ( accidental order) and It was too long and wouldn’t often give me ear aches. I decided to try the purple ones because I read it was for smaller ears. The noise canceling dB is less than the other two but it fit perfectly for me and doesn’t hurt my ears.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Great for regular use, light noise reduction for smaller ears
customer_reviews.text: These are the best for light sound protection, especially for those of us with small ears. I have basically child sized ears as an adult and these are the only ear plugs that fit comfortably enough for regular use when our downstairs neighbors decide it's Party Time at 5 am on a Tuesday. I wouldn't rely on these for heavy duty hearing protection - I can hear my dog bark and deeper bass sounds - but it's great for light noise reduction in smaller ears.
customer_reviews.author: Trailblazer7232

customer_reviews.title: These are absolutely amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally ear plugs that fit in my ear canals and don't hurt my ears. The inside of my ears the canal and ear drums all stop growing when I was 2 years old, so I have a very narrow passage inside my ears. I have never found anything I was able to wear in my ears that would stay or fit and that wouldn't hurt. These are literally a blessing and drown out the bear I sleep next to!
customer_reviews.author: SiePoc

customer_reviews.title: They fit!!
customer_reviews.text: I can never find earplugs (or earbuds/phones) to fit my ears but these work like a charm! I bought them because I have chronic daily migraines and I'm super sensitive to noise. I wear these for social events as well as just watching tv at home with others. If you're using them for sound sensitivity, just know that they don't work in every situation. Sometimes they block out the wrong noises, too much noise, or not enough, BUT these are my favorite so far. They work.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Try these if you find the original Mack's to be painful and/or too tight.
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using the original Mack's earplugs for some time, and found that upon the first few uses of a pair that I would take them out in my sleep because of the pain they caused. I hesitated buying these slim-fits, but now that I have I won't be going back to the originals. If you find the original Mack's to be painful and/or too tight, try these.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Headrick

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are my favorite, but the last 2 orders have smelled like Powerbait. Not sure if they are stored differently now or what, but it’s gross. I’ll be ordering elsewhere from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Psprouse

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: If they made some extra slim I would like them better. It appear one of my ear canal is a tad to tight. I would purchase two pack. I have to wear them deep. They get somewhat uncomfortable after a while. But they do a good job at blocking noise. More efficient than most I would say. Better fit than most also.
customer_reviews.author: Claude M.

customer_reviews.title: Finally decent sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I must have dainty little ear holes, because these were noticeably more comfortable than the standard size earplugs. If you use the smallest size earbud covers, or find that standard size earplugs makes your ear canals itch or ache, I recommend these. Blocks out all but the worst of my husband's snoring.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great Earplugs For Smaller Ear Canals
customer_reviews.text: One of my ear canals is smaller than the other. I couldn't keep using my normal earplugs for both ears because it would hurt the ear with the smaller one. I got these ad they seem great so far. They don't cancel as much noise out as my previous ones, but they do the job. I've actually started using them in both my ears because they are pretty comfortable. My only problem is the container says "50 pairs" but mine only had 48 pairs. Amazon provided a replacement, but just be aware you may not receive the correct amount of pairs. I personally always count anything I receive that is supposed to have a certain number included.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome earplugs. Slight smell
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they fit comfortable in my small ears. They're my go to. With that being said, these particular ones have a horrible fishy smell when you open the container. I am not sure if it's the plastic or what. I air dried them for days and they slightly smell still. Will use eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Like many other buyers, I have a long story of using different earplugs. I can't use regular plugs, even very soft ones, because they are thick and exercise an unbearable pressure inside the channels when expanding. These are the most comfortable in that regard, but still a bit too long to be perfect. I'll try to shorten them to make a perfect fit. In terms of noise cancellation level they are pretty good, the silence is not absolute, but the sound levels are below the bothering threshold. Overall, it is worth a try, if you have troubles using regular thick plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Small, Blocks Sound Well, Great for sensitive ears
customer_reviews.text: I am learning I have very small sensitive ears, and these are the first ear plugs I've been able to leave it while sleeping. They are definitely smaller than standard ear plugs. The standard ones were putting too much pressure on my ear canals when I had them in and would bother me too much to sleep. These fit nice and snug without being too much. If you have sensitive ears (from chronic ear infections), these are definitely worth giving a try.
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than pink. Perfect for small ears
customer_reviews.text: I loved this one. I was used to buy the pink but because I used every night, sometimes my ears suffered. When I changed to this purple, it is definitely smaller and the problem is gone. I can sleep well without noises and feeling something strange inside my ears
customer_reviews.author: robbynlim

customer_reviews.title: The most terrible ear plugs I have ever head.
customer_reviews.text: I put one in one ear and my old style in the other. After 3 minutes of this still being pressed, I gave up. I might use them for sleep, where the "go back to full form" is less important. For dailyw ork where I take them in and out a few times a day, it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sylwia

customer_reviews.title: If you've tried others and are still trying to find a perfect fit... try these!! Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: These fit amazing and they are very comfortable for an adult. My wife and I have tried other soft foam ear plugs to sleep, and these by far are THE MOST comfortable ones to date. They stayed in all night and don't work themselves back out if you toss and turn. The outter end is slimmer than others and doesn't irritate the cartilage over-night from rubbing. They reduce noise just like other foam plugs....just better fitting in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schuepfer

customer_reviews.title: A BLESSING!
customer_reviews.text: Safe to use, and I can FINALLY sleep at the weekends!!! I have anoisy household, and I can sleep at ease when the work week is over. Of course I can’t control my surroundings, but at least now I can safely plug my ears, and SLEEEEEEEEEEEEEP!!!!!!!!!!!! It’s a wonderful blessing, I swear! I’ll be ordering some more next month Insha’Allah! It’s a life saver, as I’ve been suffering for YEARS! Oh and it’s safe to use, even with sensitive ears like mine. Thank u!
customer_reviews.author: Lujain

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive ears & tinnitus!
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive ear canals that swell up and these work great. They don't seem to irritate my ears and they fit without being too much. I am able to sleep soundly when it's noisy thanks to these. I have tinnitus and I pair these with a loud white noise app on my phone. These earplugs block out annoying sounds like dogs and washing machines but I can still hear white noise to block out my ears ringing.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for Petite People
customer_reviews.text: I am a petite 5'0 woman with small features to match. I use earplugs when I travel, and most have ended up really hurting my ears over the years, due to being too large. These are a wonderful fit for me. Not too big, yet they still expand fully and cancel noise effectively. I will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Meowface

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, makes sleeping better!!
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for months, They work pretty well. Can take a couple tries to get in my ears correctly. I can’t hear most things when they’re in but I can hear people talking, coughing, lawn mowers, doors slamming shut, UPS trucks and similar, it is muffled and quieter though. Can make your ears sore if you’re not use to wearing ear plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Better than most earplugs
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are definitely more comfortable than others that I've tried. However, I must have small ear canals because I still wake up in pain sometimes when using these. As far as noise cancellation goes, I can still hear my boyfriend snoring most nights depending how well I get the earplugs in my ears, but they muffle the sound enough where I can fall asleep. So that's all I can ask.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have traditionally purchased Flents Quiet Time comfort ear plugs in the past and those have worked perfectly for me. Although I saw several users comparing these ear plugs to the Flents Quiet Time, I believe the Mack's are actually smaller. I have small-ish ear openings and I still feel like these are too small. I have to push them farther into my ear canal to get them to stay put, and even then, they are less effective at blocking out sound than the Flents. Also, because I try to push them farther into my ear canal, they are sometimes difficult to remove. I will definitely be paying the extra $2 or so for Flents next time.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cordell

customer_reviews.title: No noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I bought these ear plugs because I thought they looked similar to ones that I used in the past that worked very well, however, I was very wrong. There is absolutely no to very minimal boise cancellation. When I squeeze the ear plugs before placing them in my ears they make a crunchy plastic-like noise. I’m a light sleeper and have woken up several times in the middle of the night to noises from outside, and when I take my earplugs out the noises are the same (as in there was no actual change in diminishing the sound). If you use ear plugs for sleep, these are not the ear plugs for tou.
customer_reviews.author: Suna Horie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t know they made earplugs for kids
customer_reviews.text: I get they Say small ear canal but how do you really measure an ear canal. These were so tiny I was afraid I’d get them lost in my ear and really have to dig them out with tweezers or something. I by no means have big ears so they should have been fine. They definitely don’t cancel out the noise. I guess I have to look for jumbo ear canal plugs now?? Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chrysta Lopez

customer_reviews.title: An improvement, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment building near a university, which means I'm surrounded by late adolescents who think the community is their dorm room. Thus, I'm always on the hunt for some good ear plugs, and most hurt my ears too much to leave in. These are a bit smaller than average ear plugs and they do hurt less, but are still a bit too large for my ears. 5 stars if you can come up with an extra small!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Not that much more "petite"
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my fiance because shes quite petite and complains about the standard sized ear plugs hurting her when she sleeps. These items are not quite as petite as you'd expect, they are really just barely smaller than traditional ear plugs. If you are looking for something much smaller, get a different set.
customer_reviews.author: influence peddler

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - These are Small
customer_reviews.text: We received these yesterday and if you don't have small ear canals you will be disappointed. I put one in my ear and almost lost it in there. I didn't think I had large ear canals, but these are about half the size of a standard sized ear plug. My wife thinks she can use them, but I'm going to need to buy another set of the standard size.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit great but arrived smelling strongly like fish
customer_reviews.text: They fit great and blocked out noise during sleep. But the bottle and earplugs reek like fish. Not sure if it's a result of how they were manufactured, or if they were stored incorrectly before arriving. Either way, they are not worth the smell, and I will probably end up trashing them and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Great sound canceling slightly big for me 5'3" girl but the pain is worth
customer_reviews.text: They're not bad. Small enoguh so there's significantly less discomfort than the normal orange ones, but as a 5'3" girl they are still slightly too large so my ears hurt moderately sometimes in the morning when I take them out. Noise cancelation is f'ing great! With 3 roommates these really really come in handy every night. Blocks out almost all sound outside my door even when they're watching loud movies or partying. Makes the physical pain actually worth it, they're so effective. I reuse mine a lot so it's pretty cheap actually.
customer_reviews.author: Ria C.

customer_reviews.title: Not as effective as larger earplugs, but MUCH more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so these might not block out all noise while you're sleeping, but they are very comfortable for people with smaller ear canals. Tougher, larger earplugs normally awaken me in the middle of the night because they are hurting or itching my ear canal. That is not a problem with these!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Mismatch
customer_reviews.text: These are smaller than regular full size ear plugs. Their size makes them good for older kids or adults with small ears. However, the plug sizes are inconsistent in width and length. If it matters that things are “even” to you, find another choice.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah D.

customer_reviews.title: Too small for adult ear canals
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Suitable for children only. I'm a female adult and these were too small to do a good job blocking out noise. Ended up making me appreciate my existing earplugs (Hearos Xtreme Protection NRR 33), which I had been seeing if I could improve upon. Sticking to my Hearos I guess!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel in Washington

customer_reviews.title: Have tweezers handy for extraction
customer_reviews.text: Because this goes into the full ear canal, blocking more than the SNR rating say they do "dubjectively" with these on and some ear muffs I can't even hear my partner snore moste of the time. It is a bit scary to get one stuck inside you, just have the pproper tool ready and it is no biggie : you will be amazed at what these can do for sleep and I have tried dozens of brands over the years!
customer_reviews.author: reluctant tech

customer_reviews.title: Not a very slim fit
customer_reviews.text: These do an excellent job blocking noise, and they compress well to fit into the ear canal. However, they expand and press so firmly against my ear canal that they end up feeling more uncomfortable than Hearos and other “standard fit” ear plugs. These are great for limited periods of time in loud environments, but they’re not comfortable enough for sleeping through the night.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great size, but smaller=less noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: These are so much more comfortable for my smaller ear holes. I always have to use smaller ear buds for headphones, and it's the same with earplugs. The larger ones hurt after wearing for a longer period of time. The only issue is, because these are smaller, they do not cancel out as much noise. In my opinion, no pain>less noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa N Jones

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a few months ago and tried them for the first time last night...lot's of fireworks were I live. They just didn't work at all for me. They wouldn't stay in for more than 30 seconds no matter how far in I tried to push them. I have narrow ear canals, according to my ENT doctor, and was so excited when I saw these on Amazon. I wish there were even narrower ones available. So far the only thing that works for me is "swimmer's wax".
customer_reviews.author: La Chiquita

customer_reviews.title: They aren't perfect - they could block out more sound and can ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried SO many different earplugs where I woke up with itchy, sore ear canals or pulled them out in my sleep. These are the only ones that work. They aren't perfect - they could block out more sound and can sometimes cause itchiness - but they don't create that uncomfortable full feeling you would get from a typical ear plug.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Still too big
customer_reviews.text: I have small ears and have been looking for earplugs that work for me. These start to open just as you’re putting them in so you have to be fast. Then they almost come out as they expand. You need to make sure they are in far and tight to cancel out any noise. Very disappointed. Will keep searching for kid size. The silicon ones aren’t any better.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my ears
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking that the smaller fit wouldn’t hurt my ears as much as some other ones that I’ve tried. Unfortunately, these seem to be just a fraction too small for my ears so they don’t do a good job at keeping the noise out. For someone will smaller ears, I’m sure these would work great.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: They are the worse earplugs I’ve used ever! They don’t block any noise, is like you are not wearing anything, the material is so cheap and thin. Hated it! Does not work at all!
customer_reviews.author: DB and family

customer_reviews.title: Great for small ear holes
customer_reviews.text: Apparently as a full grown adult I have tiny baby ear holes. All other foam earplugs do not fit in my ears. These fit great. But the foam doesn't seem to be as dense so the noise cancelling isn't as good. But still better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Smells terrible, immediate itching, did not block sound at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how these earplugs are doctor approved. It's one of the worst smelling products I've ever purchased. I decided to try it out anyway to see how it did with noise cancellation and there was virtually no change. About 15 seconds in, my ears started itching.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Sandzer-Bell

customer_reviews.title: Fit great! Do not expect total sound reduction.
customer_reviews.text: I have TINY ear canals. Everything (ear plugs, earbuds, etc) hurts. These fit nicely and do NOT hurt at all. I wish they blocked more sound, but they do a decent job. And I think they block as much as the company says they will — I do not feel misled. By adding silicone earplugs over them, I can achieve a near total blockage of external sound.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great for light sleepers
customer_reviews.text: These slim fit earplugs are much more comfortable for me. I am a very light sleeper and use these to cut down ambient noise. I can still hear my alarm or louder noises. I can sleep on my side comfortably without my ears getting irritated and hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Alina Lindgren

customer_reviews.title: It fits!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, an earplug that fits! When they're in snugly, you (almost) can't hear a peep. For those with small ear canals, the noise reduction is way better than using earplugs with a higher NRR that don't fit. I use these almost nightly and have been very happy with them. You can use them two (maybe three) times if they're clean enough. After that, they loose a bit of their elasticity and become quite terrible, almost like they suddenly funnel noise into your ear instead of keeping it out. Just toss 'em at that point.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Very Slim
customer_reviews.text: These are very, very slim, and are for very small ear canals. My ear canals are too narrow, or sensitive, for most average sized ear plugs, but these are too slim for even my narrow ear canals, and therefore, do not do a very good job of blocking noise.
customer_reviews.author: NordicSkier

customer_reviews.title: Ear canal relief for daily (nightly) earplug use
customer_reviews.text: I work graveyard shift, and have been wearing these earplugs daily for the past 2 years, after switching fromdue to ear pain. These slim fit earplugs are much more comfortable for everyday use, and while they don't block out quite as much noise as the normal sized Mack's or Hearos earplugs, the difference is relatively small. I can't fall asleep if there's any outside noise, so I often suppliment with a, but I've never once been woken up while using these earplugs alone. If you've avoided using earplugs in the past due to discomfort, give these a try. They're soft, fit nicely into smaller ear canals and block out enough noise to sleep through traffic and lawnmowers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, slim fitting, and fit my ears well. Slow expansion time gave me time to adjust but getting them in place was challenging. Once in place, I noticed barely any difference in noise reduction. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Work Great! My migraines thank you!!
customer_reviews.text: I have very small ear canals and have chronic migraines. I've been using other ear plugs with some relief, but it takes me quite a while of messing with them to get them narrow enough to fit in my ear. These fit great and actually don't stick out further than my ear, which is great, because I am a side-sleeper. Best of all - they do a MUCH better job at blocking out sound than my other ones did. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Emery

customer_reviews.title: Blocks out sound very well but not comfy
customer_reviews.text: Ughhh these hurt my ears. I have small ear canals and I thought these would be perfect. Unfortunately, they were not comfy. BUT they block out sound very well. So if u hv normal sized ears then these will work for you. IMHO the original Mack’s are THE BEST if u hv medium to normal sized ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: Nida

customer_reviews.title: Best for small ears
customer_reviews.text: I must have little ears as regular ear plugs cause my ears to ache and I couldn't wear them very long. I can wear these all night long without any issues. Perfect for those of us with little ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: samjane

customer_reviews.title: not so slim
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with these ear plugs. I bought these ear plugs because they said slim fit and they are the same fit as the regular ones. They aren't slim and I needed the for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: These are more comfortable than I expected
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend snores A LOT. I wasn't too excited about using ear plugs, but we've tried different things to help me sleep through his snoring without much luck. These ear plugs are more comfortable than I expected, so I don't hate using them. I was able to lay on my side without any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Welsch

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I ordered the smaller size as they stay in better for me. I have not had them fall out during the night and I have been reusing the same pair for days so far. I am pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: They could be better
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt cancel out full snoring either but it does cancel out light snoring and outside noise like traffic and other sounds in the house. My ears sometimes hurt in the morning from them. I wear them every night. I can't sleep without them.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla A.

customer_reviews.title: These are too long to wear to bed
customer_reviews.text: These are way too long. I ordered them to block snoring noise but they're so long that I can't sleep on my side because they stick out. I can try cutting them in half but at this point I prefer cutting off a piece of a cotton ball and putting those in my ears. Way less money for the cotton balls too.
customer_reviews.author: gosasha7

customer_reviews.title: Peculiar smell
customer_reviews.text: These purple earplugs have a peculiar, very unpleasant odor. (The standard size, tan ones from the same company do not smell). Furthermore since using a pair recently I have developed an earache in my right ear, which is very concerning. Needless to say, the earplugs are going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Little Bear

customer_reviews.title: The best size and the best comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I used to have the pink ones which are larger and gave me earache. These are the only ones that don’t make my ears hurt after wearing them for entire night.
customer_reviews.author: Yanina M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 85% of people
customer_reviews.text: These are a lifesaver!!! I was looking for ear plugs smaller than the standard style because those never fit my ears and these have been a godsend. They block out about 80-85% of the sound which is good enough for me, but I would only recommend them if you don’t have LOUD noises in your house/outside your windows
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and turned down the volume
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow ear canals and these ear plugs are more comfortable than the Sleep Pretty in Pink ones. However, they aren't as effective at blocking sound. They turned down the volume a bit, and I'll likely stick with these due to the comfort and softness.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for small ear canals while riding motorcycles, and for sleeping with snoring spouse.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my small ear canals. I use them riding my motorcycle, where the wind noise could reduce my already-failing hearing. These are very comfortable, and can be reused for months if kept clean. The ONLY ones that I can wear for all-day rides. Update for a tip: If you have trouble getting them in, and are already doing the opposite hand-over to pull the lobe down during insertion trick try this. When rolling them down smaller, only roil the tip ~3/8" . I find this a great help in getting proper insertion. I think the un-rolled part serves to support better to push the other part in.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: PERRRFECCCT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OOOH these are SO good! I've tried to find earplugs like these forever. They definitely block out the noise WELL but they are soft and thin enough not to hurt my ear canals after sleeping with the all night. Plus, you can use each pair for a couple of weeks!! Most of these type of ear plugs don't squish down enough to get them in the ear canal after a day to a few days (they spring back to shape), these stay squished for long enough to get them in and they do it day after day without wearing out! I'm in love with these :)
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good for small ear canals
customer_reviews.text: I have small ear canals and these plugs fit me pretty well without too much pressure. The quality is not perfect that you can tell from the picture. I put them on to test when my friends were chatting in another room with doors open. They sounded lower but not a lot. Should work fine with people who just want to reduce the house noise during sleep.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingFox

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a small pack of these a few months ago and I love them. I have very small ears and the regular sized ones don’t fit and they hurt and then I saw these. I bought them and they worked great so I decided to buy the big container. I like the color too. Very satisfied (:
customer_reviews.author: stephanie maglietta

customer_reviews.title: They worked OK; not great, but well enough.
customer_reviews.text: I think they will be more or less effective, based on the shape of peoples' ears. I had to study for a national certification exam, and I was sitting at Starbucks because you can plug in your laptop there. Unfortunately, they play music at a level that was distracting for me, so I decided to try these. They did not *block* the sound of the music, but dampened it enough that I was able to ignore it. And I passed my exam - Yay!!!!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Too skinny and long and did NOTHING to block sound
customer_reviews.text: I read so many reviews before selecting and was so excited to try these. I regularly use earplugs because my husband snores like a freight train, but these were awkwardly long and skinny and did absolutely NOTHING to even reduce the noise. I'm a regular sized girl with regular sized ears, so I'm not sure why others say they work for them, but they most certainly did not for me and now I'm stuck with a giant jar of them to throw out.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Parrie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I use these to help me sleep when I’m traveling, and they work great! They keep just enough noise out, and I can still hear my alarm in the morning. Very comfortable, I can’t even feel them at night.
customer_reviews.author: Luciana Prass

product_meta.title: Mack's Slim Fit Soft Foam Earplugs, 50 Pair - Small Ear Plugs for Sleeping, Snoring, Traveling, Concerts, Shooting Sports & Power Tools
product_meta.description: Do you roll and roll foam earplugs and still have difficulty getting them into your ear canals or getting them to stay put? Despite carefully following the directions, do you find that your ears still hurt or ache after wearing standard-sized foam earplugs? If so, there is a good chance you have small ear canals. Mack's Slim Fit Soft Foam Ear Plugs are your solution, designed with a slightly smaller diameter, providing comfort to those with smaller and sensitive ear canals. If you want to block out snoring, harmful noise, loud neighbors, study or simply relax, get the fit, comfort and protection you desire with Mack’s Slim Fit Soft Foam Earplugs. Please carefully follow the package and video instructions to ensure the best fit and performance.
feature_bullets: SMALL EAR PLUGS - Designed about 20% smaller than Mack's standard-sized foam earplugs to provide maximum comfort for small or sensitive ear canals
MAXIMUM COMFORT - Molded with super low-pressure, skinned and tapered, slow release foam, providing unmatched user comfort and hygiene. Great for side sleeping.

HEARING PROTECTION - With a high Noise Reduction Rating (NRR) of 29 decibels, these noise blocking earplugs are great for sleeping, snoring, studying, power tools, shooting sports, travel, loud events, etc.
USA’s #1 DOCTOR RECOMMENDED BRAND - Mack’s is the #1 Doctor Recommended Earplug Brand to Protect Hearing or Prevent Hearing Loss. Trust Mack’s, the brand that doctors trust.

MADE IN THE USA - Proudly made in the USA with safe, high performance, noise reducing foam. Satisfaction guaranteed. The plastic jar is safety-sealed and features a convenient flip-open top for easy dispensing.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
